title: Data Migration & Transformation Tools
description: This page includes a number of utilities to migrate and transform your data. Note that in most cases, tools that are compatible with Apache CouchDB will also work with Cloudant so are included for your reference.

title: Create/Read/Update/Delete operations via Cloudant's RESTful API
description: A simple guide to creating, reading, updating and deleting documents using Cloudant's simple HTTP API.

title: Cloudant Search - A Beginners Guide
description: Create full-text search indexes, built on Apache Lucene, with Cloudant Search. This step-by-step guide shows you how.

title: Cloudant _all_docs
description: A guide to using Cloudant's _all_docs endpoint to retrieve documents by id, or within a range of keys using this interactive tutorial.

title: Cloudant FAQ
description: The most frequently asked questions about the Cloudant database.

title: Introducing Cloudant Query
description: Cloudant Query gives you a declarative way to define and query indexes on your database. Based on MongoDB's query language, Cloudant Query makes it simple to query your data using simple operators.

title: Using Cloudant with Node.js
description: A guide to some of the tools you can use to interact with Cloudant when using the Node.js programming language.

title: Webizing your database with linked data
description: JSON-LD (JSON Linked Data) is a simple way of providing semantic meaning for the terms and values in a JSON document. Providing that meaning with the JSON means that the next developer's application can parse and understand the JSON you gave them.

title: Cloudant Sync
description: Cloudant Sync allows you to create native mobile apps for iOS and Android that can store data locally and sync with Cloudant when online. This allows your mobile application continue to work offline to deliver a great user experience.

title: Introducing Cloudant Local
description: Cloudant Local brings Cloudant's NoSQL database to customers whose regulatory restrictions make it difficult to put their data into the cloud.

title: PouchDB
description: PouchDB is in-browser database that syncs with any Couch-like database such as Cloudant. It allows offline-first mobile and web-apps to be created that sync to the cloud when online.

title: Building apps using Java with Cloudant
description: The BlueMix Platform-as-a-Service allows Java applications to use a Cloudant database to store their data. This guide shows you how.

title: Choosing the right Geospatial index
description: Cloudant's Geospatial features allow GIS applications to built for a fraction of a cost of traditional solutions. This blog post describes the choices you face when choosing a Geospatial index for your applicaiton.

title: Schemas in CouchDB
description: NoSQL doesn't force you to define the schema of your documents up front. That isn't to say that you have no schema in your database, only that you have flexibility to alter it at will. This blog post describes some techniques for how to organise your data to minimise storage while retaining document readability.

title: Quilter: Open-source file sharing
description: Quilter is an open-source project that allows files to be stored and shared using Cloudant.

title: Syncing Car Telemetry Data in Real-Time
description: Cloudant's Traffic Tamer app collects car telemetry data. Every time a car stops, this event is synchronized with Cloudant to enable crowd-sourced traffic information. This post describes how PouchDB is used to collect data offline and sync to Cloudant when on the network.

title: Authorized Curl - a.k.a acurl
description: At Cloudant, we use curl a lot to interact with Cloudant's HTTP API. 'acurl' is a tool that allows you to interact with Cloudant without having to enter the username and password with every request.

title: Coding for Eventual Consistency
description: Cloudant is a highly available, partition tolerant distributed database and as such is 'eventually consistent', as per CAP Theorem. This blog outlines some techniques for dealing with eventual consistency in practice.

title: Replication with Cloudant - Part 1
description: Cloudant's replication features allows data to synced within accounts, across Cloudant clusters and to othe Couch-like targets such as CouchDB & PouchDB. Part one of three.

title: Replication with Cloudant - Part 2
description: Cloudant's replication features allows data to synced within accounts, across Cloudant clusters and to othe Couch-like targets such as CouchDB & PouchDB. Part two of three.

title: Replication with Cloudant - Part 3
description: Cloudant's replication features allows data to synced within accounts, across Cloudant clusters and to othe Couch-like targets such as CouchDB & PouchDB. Part three of three.

title: Why replication is awesome
description: Cloudant's replication allows you to replicate your data across Cloudant clusters to provide a global "CDN" for your database. This blog post shows how this can also power the offline-first design pattern, to store data locally first and sync to the cloud when there is an internet connection.

title: Search faceting from scratch
description: Cloudant Search is based on Apache Lucene which allows facets of your data to be aggregated and counted during the search process. Facets allow your customers to drill-down into the search results, filtering in an powerful and intuitive way.

title: Introducing Data Warehousing and Analytics with Cloudant and dashDB
description: Cloudant data can be imported into IBM dashDB with a couple clicks in the Cloudant dashboard. Once imported, the data can be queried using SQL and R to allow you to perform ad-hoc queries to gain insights into your data.

title: Top 6 Questions about SQL -> NoSQL Migrations
description: Developers coming to Cloudant from an SQL background will have lots of questions about importing data, schemas and authentication. This post answers the most frequently asked questions.

title: Full Text Indexing and Query
description: Cloudant Search, based on Apache Lucene, allows full-text and field search across your JSON document store. This post demonstrates the feature set using data from lobbyist disclosures from the US Senate.

title: Simple Geo searching with Cloudant Search
description: Cloudant Search's Lucene index allows simple geographic searches to be performed by querying within latitude/longitude ranges. This post shows you how.

title: Cloudant why?
description: Cloudant co-founder Mike Miller talks about Cloudant's origins as database used build to deal with huge datasets produced by the Large Hadron Collider project at CERN.

title: 10 Common Misconceptions about CouchDB
description: Joan Touzet talks about ten common misconceptions about CouchDB and lends insight into best practices and design patterns.

title: Introduction to Cloudant Query
description: Cloudant's Dan DeMichele introduces Cloudant Query, a declartive query language for NoSQL data, based on MongoDB's query language.

title: Building Mobile Apps At The Geospatial Edge
description: Norman Barker & Chris Glew talk about using Cloudant to create geospatial applications for shipping, logistics and transportation.

title: Cloudant's Traffic Tamer App
description: A demonstration of an offline-first traffic data collection system built with Ford and using PouchDB to Cloudant replication

title: Replication in CouchDB
description: Cloudant co-founter Adam Kocoloski talks about Cloudant's replication capabilities for producing applications where systems can be disconnected and sync seamlessly when reconnected.

title: Building IoT Apps on Cloudant, with Kiwi Wearables
description: Andy Ellicott and John David Chibuk talk about an Internet of Things application to record data captured from wearable technology and recorded in Cloudant

title: Overcoming Mobile App Challenges with IBM MobileFirst & Cloudant
description: Anthony Abdulla and Michael Snare talk about how Cloudant is at the heart of IBM's MobileFirst framework for creating the next generation of mobile apps.

title: Using NoSQL DBaaS to launch Life Science Software
description: Claudius Li and Barry Wark talk about how Life Science Software uses Cloudant to store biological and chemical experimental data.

title: The Cloud Application Stack for IOT
description: Dan DeMichele talks about how Cloudant is uniquely positioned to store data from mobile and Internet-of-Things devices, from edge locations or using off-line first design patterns.

title: Libraries and Tutorials
description: A list of software libraries and tutorials for a variety of programming languages

title: Data Rich Applications
description: A demonstration of how Cloudant can use MapReduce to gain insights to large JSON datasets.

title: Learning Center
description: Developers new to Cloudant will welcome this list of guides and tutorials for how to get started with Cloudant.

title: Data Security in dashDB
description: The security of your data is paramount. This document describes how dashDB's data is encrypted both in transit and at rest and how you can control which users have access to your databases.

title: IBM dashDB - Keeping data warehouse infrastructure out of your way
description: IBM dashDB allows ad-hoc querying of data from Cloudant using R or SQL for data warehousing and predictive analytics.

title: Saying Goodbye to Messy Data with Data Warehousing and Analytics with Cloudant and dashDB
description: IBM dashDB's scheam discovery technology can seamlessly convert complex JSON documents stored in IBM Cloudant into tables. This guide shows how.

title: dashDB Sample Applications
description: A range of sample applications to explore that highlight the features of IBM dashDB on BlueMix.
